item.title: Russia Plans to Become a Blockchain Leader by 2035
item.description:
Russia Plans to Become a Blockchain Leader by 2035

According to Russian news agency TASS, the country's authorities are planning to propel Russia to the top of technologically advanced nations. For that purpose, they created National Technological Initiative focused on long-term strategy of technological advancement.

item.title: Here's How Bitcoin Can Save Media From Broken Adtech
item.description:
Here's How Bitcoin Can Save Media From Broken Adtech

People have gotten wise to online ads and started blocking them all over the world. "It's been called the biggest boycott ever," Bitcoin Strategy Group co-founder Victoria Van Eyk said during a panel on media and micropayments at the Blockchain+Digital Currencies conference today in Manhattan.

item.title: An Explanation On Dark Patterns, The User Interfaces Designed To Trick People
item.description:
An Explanation On Dark Patterns, The User Interfaces Designed To Trick People

'THIS IS NOT WHAT I SIGNED UP FOR' Most of us have had the experience of getting annoyed at some pre-checked boxes on the internet, but it actually goes deeper than that.

item.title: South Korean Bank to work on the Blockchain | HolyTransaction
item.description:
South Korean Bank to work on the Blockchain | HolyTransaction

One of the most important banks in South Korea revealed today an agreement with the most funded Asiatic startup of the bitcoin sector. KB Kookmin, in fact, announced today that will sign a memorandum of understanding with the Bitcoin startups Circle and Coinplug .

item.title: Coinbase's First Employee is Leaving to Start His Own Hedge Fund - CoinDesk
item.description:
Coinbase's First Employee is Leaving to Start His Own Hedge Fund - CoinDesk

Olaf Carlson-Wee, the first employee at venture-backed bitcoin exchange Coinbase, has departed as head of risk and product manager to focus on a new digital currency hedge fund, dubbed Polychain Capital.

item.title: European Commission Proposes the Creation of a Bitcoin User Database
item.description:
European Commission Proposes the Creation of a Bitcoin User Database

The European Commission, a branch of the European Union, has proposed the creation of a centralized database of Bitcoin users, their identities, wallets and financial operations. The directive seeks to prevent the use of the cryptocurrency to finance terrorist movements and their operations.

item.title: Major Bitcoin/Ethereum Exchange: Ethereum Classic is a Scam
item.description:
Major Bitcoin/Ethereum Exchange: Ethereum Classic is a Scam

It seems all year long, the digital currency community has been abuzz over Ethereum. From its meteoric rise in January, moving from less than #1 USD in value to over $15 USD by mid-February, to the innovative, but ill-fated DAO experiment, Ethereum has been all over the news.

item.title: Bet on MMA with Bitcoin: UFC 201 Betting Picks - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
Bet on MMA with Bitcoin: UFC 201 Betting Picks - Bitcoinist.net

Bitcoin is becoming the preferred payment method for sportsbooks. It is cheaper than other deposit and withdrawal options for both sportsbook and player, compared to other methods that often involve high fees and sometimes long waiting times.

item.description:
How have fungiblity problems affected you in Bitcoin? * /r/Bitcoin
